pr_title: Improve 404 error message on install for Jira Server

timeline.message: refactor: Improving the error message handling for installMarketplaceServerApp

timeline.bodyText: Can we actually change this part of the message "Please install the app yourself or request a compatibility update." to "Please install the app manually or request a compatibility update."
timeline.author: jamesrichard91

timeline.bodyText: What determines if the status-code is an error or if an exception is thrown?
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: This was from the existing code, it requires access to Response object which is now created on line 82 so we included it into the try-catch block.
replies.author: ChomickiM

replies.bodyText:
Right, but isn't 404 an error status-code? Why does an exception get thrown for a 404 and not for any other error code (like 400, 401, 500, etc).
To clarify my questions:

Will jiraAppService.installMarketplaceServerApp(...) only throw an exception for a 404 or will it also throw an exception for other errors?
Which errors does response.isStatusCodeError() work for if an exception is being thrown for some errors?
replies.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: From looking at the code the jira service will throw an exception for any response where the response code >= 400 a bad request.  The response.isStatusCodeError isn't needed here since if there is an error an exception will always be thrown.
replies.author: psantos1113

replies.bodyText: If that's the case, does that mean that before these changes, this never worked?
replies.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: It was likely there just in case the library changed.
